questions.stem: What is the primary focus of structural editing?
questions.rationale: Structural editing focuses on the big picture: organization, flow, logic, and content development.

questions.stem: Order these editing levels from first to last:
questions.rationale: Editing proceeds from big picture to small details: structure → style → mechanics → final check.

questions.stem: What does stylistic editing focus on?
questions.rationale: Stylistic editing improves clarity, tone, word choice, and sentence structure.

questions.stem: What does copy editing address? (Select all that apply)
questions.rationale: Copy editing handles grammar, spelling, punctuation, consistency, and formatting details.

questions.stem: When should proofreading occur?

options.label: At the same time as copy editing
After all other editing is complete

questions.rationale: Proofreading is the final stage, done after all other editing is complete.

questions.stem: What is the main purpose of proofreading?
questions.rationale: Proofreading catches typos, missed errors, and formatting problems.

questions.stem: Good proofreading techniques include: (Select all that apply)
questions.rationale: Effective proofreading uses multiple techniques and fresh eyes.

questions.stem: Click on the proofreading error:
questions.text: The comittee will meet on Wendesday to discuss the budget.
questions.rationale: Spelling error: 'committee' (double 't') and 'Wednesday'.

questions.stem: What does the symbol '⌃' mean in proofreading?
questions.rationale: The caret symbol (⌃) indicates where to insert text or punctuation.

questions.stem: Match proofreading symbols with their meanings:
questions.rationale: Standard proofreading symbols communicate specific editing instructions.

questions.stem: What does 'stet' mean?
questions.rationale: 'Stet' (Latin for 'let it stand') cancels a previous correction.

questions.stem: To indicate that two letters should switch positions, use the symbol _____.
questions.rationale: 'tr' (transpose) indicates that elements should switch positions.

questions.stem: Why are editing checklists useful?

options.label: They replace the need for careful reading
They ensure systematic coverage of all elements
They speed up the editing process
They eliminate the need for proofreading

questions.rationale: Checklists ensure you systematically check all important elements.

questions.stem: A good revision checklist should include: (Select all that apply)
questions.rationale: Checklists should cover content, clarity, mechanics, and formatting.

questions.stem: When using a checklist, you should:

options.label: Check everything in one quick pass
Focus on one type of issue at a time
Only use it for important documents

questions.rationale: Focus on one category at a time for more thorough checking.

questions.stem: What is the main limitation of spell-check programs?

options.label: They don't catch correctly spelled wrong words

questions.rationale: Spell-check won't catch 'there/their/they're' or other correctly spelled wrong words.

questions.stem: How should you use grammar-checking software?

options.label: As a helpful tool requiring human judgment

questions.rationale: Grammar checkers are tools that require human judgment to evaluate suggestions.

questions.stem: Technology tools can help with: (Select all that apply)
questions.rationale: Technology helps with mechanics but can't replace human judgment on content and style.

questions.stem: What should you do before final submission?

options.label: Just run spell-check one more time
Have someone else review the document

questions.rationale: Fresh eyes often catch errors the writer has missed.

questions.stem: Why is it hard to proofread your own writing?

options.label: You see what you intended to write, not what's there
You don't know the rules well enough
You care too much about the content

questions.rationale: Writers often read what they meant to write rather than what's actually on the page.

questions.stem: The final review should check for _____, consistency, and accuracy.
questions.rationale: Final review ensures completeness, consistency, and accuracy before submission.

cards.back: Doesn't catch wrong words spelled correctly
